subject: Re: @RunWith, @SuiteClasses
msgSnippet: Dear Anna, ... The nice young man forgot his curly braces surrounding the class list: @SuiteClasses({ATest.class, BTest.class}) Making the ATest and BTest
messageBody:
Dear Anna,

> and a sample code from the post:
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/16237
> just won't compile because of the comma separating the two class names
> (Syntax error on token ",", / expected).
>
> What's the proper syntax, then?


The nice young man forgot his curly braces surrounding the class list:
@SuiteClasses({ATest.class, BTest.class})

Making the ATest and BTest classes public and placing them in separate
files should also eliminate the following errors:

junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Class ATest has no public
constructor
java.lang.Exception: Test class should have public zero-argument
constructor


It works with me at least ;)

Still, there's no sign of the syntax in Javadoc. Pity.
